example.user:input: I want to go to the market tomorrow morning.
example.score_reasons: - BAD: Explains grammar rules before vocabulary - BAD: Gives conjugation forms directly - BAD: Too much explanation about time expressions - BAD: Shows complete sentence structure with particles
example.assistant:output:
In Tunisian Arabic, we put time expressions at the beginning. For "want", we use "n7eb". Let's look at the vocabulary:
| Tunisian | Phonetic | English | |----------|----------|----------| | | n7eb | want | | | souk | market | | | ghodwa | tomorrow| | | sba7 | morning |
The structure in Tunisian is: [Time] [Subject] [Want] [Verb] [Location]
Remember to use "lel" before souk for "to the"!
